Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the entire game world. (Designed to be instantiated just once for the whole game).
    Author:
    Mubashwer Salman Khurshid (mskh, 601738)

      • update

        public void update(float xDir,
                   float yDir,
                   int delta,
                   boolean mousePressed,
                   int mouseScreenX,
                   int mouseScreenY,
                   boolean arrowKeyPressed,
                   boolean interactPressed,
                   boolean attackPressed)
            throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Update the game state for a frame.
        Parameters:
        xDir - The 's movement in the x axis (-1, 0 or 1).
        yDir - The 's movement in the y axis (-1, 0 or 1).
        delta - Time passed since last frame (milliseconds).
        mousePressed - True if mouse is pressed.
        mouseScreenX - X coordinate in screen where mouse is clicked.
        mouseScreenY - Y coordinate in screen where mouse is clicked.
        arrowKeyPressed - True if an arrow key is pressed.
        interactPressed - True if interact button is pressed.
        attackPressed - True if attack button is pressed.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

      • render

            throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Render the entire screen, so it reflects the current game state.
        Parameters:
        g - The Slick graphics object, used for drawing.
        Throws:

      • blocked

        public boolean blocked(float xPos,
                       float yPos)
        Checks whether given location in map is blocked or not.
        Parameters:
        xPos - x coordinate of unit in map.
        yPos - y coordinate of unit in map.
        Returns:
        boolean value true if tile is blocked otherwise false
